means: 打扰( bother的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: It bothered me that boys weren't interested in me.
sentence.Network_cn: 男孩子们对我不感兴趣令我很烦恼。

sentence.Network_en: I was bothered about the blister on my hand.
sentence.Network_cn: 手上起的水泡让我心烦。

sentence.Network_en: I just can't be bothered to look after the house.
sentence.Network_cn: 我就是不想费事照看这所房子。

PerfectNetExp.abs: One should not be bothered about one ' s personal gains or losses ., 不应当为个人得失而烦恼.
Perhaps , you shouldn ' t even have bothered lard ., 或许当初你们还真的不需要那么麻烦.
We can ' t be bothered to lie time like the young ., 我们不能像年轻人那样老是费脑子说谎话.
but it's also true that lots of people dislike being bothered .但是，同样的事实是，很多人不喜欢被别人打扰。

list.abs: 何怎么组词_百度知道 ... 何遽[ how] 何苦[ why bother] 你何苦为这点鸡毛蒜皮的事跟他吵 [呢] ?[ is it worth the trouble].
李阳疯狂英语365句 - 豆丁网 ... Don' t be so modest. 别这么谦虚。 Don' t bother. 不用麻烦了。 Don' t get me wrong. 别误会我。.
模块九模块十单词短语背诵_laogao_新浪博客 ... bother to do 特意，特地; bother doing 麻烦做某事 be engaged to 与…….订婚.
“什么意思?”用英语怎么说？-英语-外语-天涯问答 ... Me,too. 我也要。 No bother. 不麻烦。 ... Meaning 什么意思？.

entry.def: If you do not bother to do something or if you do not bother with it, you do not do it, consider it, or use it because you think it is unnecessary or because you are too lazy.

example.ex: Lots of people don't bother to go through a marriage ceremony these days...
example.tran: 如今很多人不再费心思举行婚礼。

example.ex: Most of the papers didn't even bother reporting it...
example.tran: 大多数报纸甚至懒得去报道这件事。

entry.def: Bother means trouble or difficulty. You can also use bother to refer to an activity which causes this, especially when you would prefer not to do it or get involved with it.

example.ex: I usually buy sliced bread — it's less bother...
example.tran: 我通常都买切片面包——比较省事。

example.ex: The courts take too long and going to the police is a bother...
example.tran: 打官司耗时太久，去找警察也很麻烦。

entry.tran: 麻烦（用于淡化问题的严重性）
entry.def: You use bother to refer to serious trouble, usually when you want to make it sound less serious than it really is.

example.ex: Vince is having a spot of bother with the law.

entry.def: If something bothers you, or if you bother about it, it worries, annoys, or upsets you.

example.ex: That kind of jealousy doesn't bother me...

entry.def: If someone bothers you, they talk to you when you want to be left alone or interrupt you when you are busy.

example.ex: We are playing a trick on a man who keeps bothering me...
example.tran: 我们在捉弄一个总是来烦我的人。

example.ex: I don't know why he bothers me with this kind of rubbish.
example.tran: 我不明白他为何用这种烂事来烦我。

entry.def: Some people say 'bother' or 'bother it' when they are annoyed about something.
If you say that you can't be bothered to do something, you mean that you are not going to do it because you think it is unnecessary or because you are too lazy.

example.ex: I just can't  be bothered to look after the house...
example.tran: 我就是不想费事照看这所房子。

example.ex: Doctors cannot be bothered to explain what they do.
example.tran: 医生们才懒得解释他们所做的事情。

entry.tran: 这不麻烦；不费事；没什么
entry.def: If you say 'it's no bother' after offering to do something for someone, you are emphasizing that you really want to do it and that it will take very little effort.

example.ex: I'll drive you back to your hotel later. It's no bother.
example.tran: 我一会儿会开车把你送回宾馆，举手之劳。

sentences.sentence: "refused to be fazed by the objections"

auth_sentence.content: Kind of wish I hadn't bothered to myself.

auth_sentence.res_content: I am not overly bothered by now knowing precisely.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I am not overly bothered by now knowing precisely.

auth_sentence.content: He might now be wishing they had not bothered.
auth_sentence.res_content: He might now be wishing they had not bothered.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He might now be wishing they had not bothered.

Sentence.sentence: He is bothered by the pain in his neck.
